pros: Small, private college with reasonable supports offered to new faculty.

Downsizing has resulted in many faculty being cut without warning after several years of employment.

cons: If you enjoy having little self-respect, it can be hard to leave for greener pastures, which exist quite literally everywhere.

job_title: Student Worker in New York, NY
pros: Good could be worse, pays the bills.
cons: Work is work. And late hours.

job_title: Resident Assistant in Ithaca College, NY
pros: Great experience working in a team
cons: Sometimes time consuming and tedious

pros:
There are individuals here who stand out in their mission toward students. They are a delight to work with.

Research requirements for an academic institution of this size are reasonable.

Investment in professional development.
cons:
Educating students at this school is challenging. The majority want something easy that they don't have to work for (but they want to feel like they learned something). Current policies do hold students accountable. Teaching felt like a grind.

Average compensation for all faculty may be comparable to sister institutions, but it is well below average for Assistant Professors.

Expectations were often unclear and not communicated until the final review from both students and faculty.

Future policies seem predicated on shrinking student markets, which means accepting students who are less prepared. It also means squeezing more out of faculty with less resources.

review_title: Beware: things have certainly changed and not for the better!
pros: Ithaca College USED to be a great place to work. They respected work-life balance and had an inclusive, diverse and humane environment where people felt safe in sharing their views.
cons: Now that the college is "tightening up" on their budget, many staff that leave are not being replaced. Those who remain are overworked to the point where they cannot have a life anymore. They've been having layoffs (at least 40 this year) and also replacing employees who they think are  "earning too much." Everyone seems on edge and morale is terrible. How sad that it has changed so drastically.

job_title: Marketing Communications Manager in Ithaca, NY
pros: Working with many of the faculty, staff and students has been enjoyable and stimulating.
cons: Financial cutbacks and layoffs leading to widespread fear and cutthroat office politics. Cold, calculating, narcissistic leaders at the very top of the pyramid coming in and choosing sacrificial lambs for their own self serving ends. Nobody feels safe or loyal when they see talented, good, dedicated people let go or replaced for no valid reason whatsoever.

review_title: Not bad for staff or students, not good for faculty members
pros: Ithaca College provides excellent benefits (though the value decreases each year), free parking, and a stimulating academic environment.
cons:
-Salaries are low because "everyone wants a job in Ithaca." 
-Administrators are closed-minded and decisions are increasingly made without genuine faculty or staff input.
-Students are promised the moon to enroll at Ithaca College, so a large proportion (though not all) are bratty and entitled. 
-Too many professors are working way past the time they should have retired. Classes are recycled for years.
-Little innovation or friendliness among professors; I've never worked before with such a selfish group of people.
-Frequent turnover of Provost-level employees.
-Travel funds and adjunct/overload pay has not changed in at least seven years.
-Tenure process unclear, unfair, and arbitrary.

pros: Friendly, open, relaxed and interesting educational atmosphere. Great benefits and management is truly open to hear your ideas to improve things, especially if they directly impact the student experience.
cons: Unsustainable demographics for the current financial situation (61k/year - pulling most students from the shrinking northeast region). Fewer students can pay the full ride and the budget is almost completely tuition driven. Running at near break even because of 50% discounting, so the 61k is an illusion.

job_title: Student Assistant to the Deans' Suite/Marketing Communications in Ithaca, NY
pros: Ithaca College was an incredible school to study at and work for. During my three-year study, I found a myriad of jobs and had numerous supervisors. Throughout my time, the college was supportive, helpful and easy to work with! If you are looking to work or live in a beautiful, peaceful, friendly, upstate city, I highly suggest moving to Ithaca!
cons: The HR policies for firing employees is very immature. Too often, I would find myself working with some staff members whose abilities did not meet the new requirements for their job, yet they continued to hold their positions.

review_title: A great place to work! A great place to live!
pros: It's a great institution that cares about its employees. The College worked hard to avoid layoffs during the hard economic times. Instead, they cut costs, and came out with a budget surplus.
cons: It's challenging to move up, because so many people are happy working at IC. When positions do open up, the hiring process is unnecessarily long.

job_title: Director of Client and Enrollment Marketing in Ithaca, NY
pros: Very passionate employees. Great benefits. Great views every day. The energy of a college campus is unbeatable.
cons: President Rochon's initiatives and poor leadership have created turmoil and distrust among faculty, staff, and students.

pros: Great staff that feels like family. Professors are all very pleasant and caring. Denise Vanderburgh (Administrative Assistant and my supervisor) genuinely cares about her employees well-being.
cons: Mostly general cleaning and physical labor tasks within the department. There are times where the work becomes a little boring and repetitive (cleaning off charcoal on the drawing tables).

review_title: Uninterested in Junior Faculty Employment Issues
pros: Faculty Collegial in General, Benefit Packages Very Good
cons: Administratively Overbearing and Top-Heavy, No Revenue Sharing with Faculty, Out of Control Student Entitlement.

pros: I worked several different jobs at the college while a student there. The best one was through my own department, as you tend to get a lot of support from the faculty in my experience.
cons: Different jobs around campus have different managers and different experiences. Wildly different. Also communication between different areas is almost non-existent.

pros: I enjoyed working as a teaching assistant. If you want to do this, it has to be for your love of the subject, not for the pay. It was enjoyable to teach people. I lead drill sessions for a foreign language and enjoyed watching the intro students grow. You get paid for 3 hours but you rarely spend that much time preparing.
cons: Little hours. 3 hours per TA session. Minimum wage, but that is expected with such an easy job.

pros: I was able to teach student about finance and how to choose securities for their investment portfolios.  I also graded homework.
cons: The only real con about this job was the low amount of hours each week.  We only worked about 8 hours every two weeks, and I would have liked to work more.

job_title: Database and Applications Administrator in Ithaca, NY
pros: Great culture.  Truly refreshing place to be.  Fantastic educational opportunities and benefits.
cons: Salary is low for industry.  Technology initiatives have not kept pace with the times.

pros: Good student employment, good networking with professors, lots of opportunities for hands-on experience as a student employee. Enjoyed working with my peers, learning things I couldn't have learned from just being a student, and gaining a wider perspective of the world.
cons: Tuition is high for student employees, have heard whispers about how associate/adjunct professors are treated.

review_title: Information Technology as a Student Worker
pros:
- Very kind IT Staff
- Accepting of all individuals regardless of technological background
- Paid training that will prepare one for their role
- Usually flexible with hours, coverage when things don't go as planned
cons:
- Troublesome student wages issues (not raising wages to levels promised, near-minimum wage)
- Minimum wage

job_title: Orientation Leader/Annual Fund Phoner in Ithaca, NY
pros: Very keen staff ready to help make it an easy place to work for anyone from anywhere. Anyone you find is approachable and friendly.
cons: Harsh winters are key. Driving in the winter is very tricky due to the hills unless you have very good tires.

pros: Great Place to work if you want to live in or around Ithaca
cons: Since it's a small town and there are few employers no one is leaving therefore there is little room for advancement.

review_title: Good ratio of students to faculty, financial aid for international students, and campus employment
pros:
-Lots of opportunities to be connected in a meaningful way with faculty members
-Generous financial aid for international students along with more scholarships opportunities
-various types of campus employment you will enjoy (TA, RA, Library, etc)
-Great natural environment
cons:
-Isolated area (not too many places to hang out with friends)
-Too cold during winter

pros: Good location, safe city with good schools, affordable cost of living, natural beauty
cons: Benefits are middle-of-the-road. Health care is expensive. Starting salaries are below average in some departments, and absence of merit pay. High taxes eat up wages.

review_title: Good, flexible top college management -- individual departments less so
pros:
Excellent benefits
Pleasant, collegial work environment
cons:
Much lower salary than for comparable jobs elsewhere
Lack of consistent college-wide HR policies allows for some antiquated practices to follow under individual department managers, e.g., requiring salaried staff to clock in and out for lunch or gain manager's approval to leave 1 hour early for a doctor's app't.

pros: Ithaca College offers flexible work hours (within reason), terrific wellness programs, CSA membership/pick up opportunities, and much more. The students here are innovative achievers. The campus community is engaged and dedicated to our students and their overall success. There is free parking for staff, as well as lots of opportunities to engage in campus events!
cons: No Cons to mention currently.

review_title: Great place, wish the job offers were long term
pros: Full time includes benefits. Great people work here.
cons: Hard to get employment that is consistent and reliable. A challenge to maintain work/life balance.

review_title: Great place to work - you get a lot of support form colleagues and administrators
pros: Balanced work load and good support from the college administration and peers
cons: The Salary for science faculty is about $20,000 to low for the level of science that we conduct at this institution.

pros:
I got to hang out with my favorite professor.
I was able to pay my utilities bill at the end of the month
Sometimes I blew my earnings on Wegmans peanut butter (that stuff is the greatest)
cons:
Early morning class made for early work hours
The pay is terrible, and no overtime
The time sheet system, really, the worst.

pros: Free meals if you work in the dining halls.
cons: Depending on what you do in the dining hall, the job can be very boring. Worked as a busboy/server. If your shift that day is cleaning the tables, you have to walk around the dining hall for at least three hours to find tables to clean.

review_title: IC was a wonderful place to work
job_title: Associate Vice President, Marketing Communications in Ithaca, NY
pros: I have nothing but great things to say about my four-year tenure at Ithaca College. It was a collaborative, collegial environment with a heck of a view in an incredible town. The salary and benefits were top notch.
cons: At the time, there was little room for growth/advancement.

review_title: Love everyone and the Ithaca College community
pros: Working here has been the best. I love the people and the students there. If you work hard, your time will pay off.
cons:
The weather is brutal but if that doesn't bother you, than you are fine.
A lot of hills!

pros: Working right on campus, interacting with other students and prospective students, competitive pay, interactions with admissions staff and higher-ups of company.
cons: It's so cold in Ithaca but the spring and fall are wonderful!

pros: Best years of my life. I learned so much there and it has really helped me in the future.

pros: Supervisor is flexible, understanding.  Always willing to set time aside to help me grow, both as a person and an employee.
cons: Hardly work any hours, then again I'm busy with school work.

pros: Benefits, specifically paid time off are excellent.
cons: Wage compensation is lacking. Upper management is overly compensated, while those at a lower level are often overlooked for increases.
